FULL for both

no reason.  I'm reusing a current server and app setting thus staying with them for consistency.
If you're targeting the next release it should be 20.0.0.7
Change to 20.0.0.7 as it may not make to 20.0.0.6 due to translation ...

Actually looks like you'll need metatype translations so 20008 since those have been sent already for 20007.

Set this property to true to send response redirect without checking and converting to an absolute URL location.
does this mean the response redirect is not converted to an absolute URL location? or the destination of the redirect is not converted?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -174,3 +174,6 @@ getRealPathReturnsQualifiedPath.desc=Return non-null paths from the ServletConte
 
 stopAppStartUponListenerException.name=Stop application for unhandled listener exception
 stopAppStartUponListenerException.desc=Some web applications depend on context listeners for setup before the web application starts. Set this property to true to stop the application from starting up when an unhandled exception is thrown from the context listeners.
+
+redirectToRelativeUrl.name=Send response redirect to a relative URL location
+redirectToRelativeUrl.desc=Send response redirect to a relative URL location without processing it. Set this property to true to send response redirect without checking and converting to an absolute URL location.

nodes.bodyText: The URL that passes into the response redirect is not converted.  For example, when you request to initial Page_A which requires you to login, that Page_A will response with a sendRedirect((/Login_Page/B").  By default, the server will convert that "/Login_Page/B" to an absolute URL like "http://someHost:somePort/Login_Page/B" before sending that back to the client.  When set to true, "/Login_Page/B" is sent back to the client as-is.

nodes.bodyText:
Is "redirect response" the established term? I see Response.redirect() cited elsewhere referring to the redirect method on the Response interface. But it seems like in plain text reference it is more often referred to as a "redirect response"
For example:
sendRedirect(java.lang.String location):  Sends a temporary redirect response to the client using the specified redirect location URL.
From Tomcat doc for Interface HttpServletResponse
